<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#14810](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/14810.html) (qt: Enable tabbing through labels by hebast
Did a quick test and looks good (https://bitcoin.jonasschnelli.ch/build/946).\n\nutACK 3537c8345c788a527bb4e1d00683ca7f8ee5fb1a
tACK 3537c83 on macOS 10.14.2, keeping the selection looks better to me.\n\nWill review changes to `debugwindow.ui`.
On macOS this broke the visibility of the Services (scrolled all way to the right end)

@HashUnlimited you can adjust a view by moving `QSplitter` bar (marked by a dot on your screenshot) and window borders:\n\n![macos high sierra_18_01_2019_14_29_35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/51387106-95126600-1b2d-11e9-9aa1-b4514c4d0d69.png)
ah OK... thanks. pretty confusing though that scrolling doesn't reveal all contents.

[QSplitter Class docs:](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qsplitter.html#details)

> Note: Adding a QLayout to a QSplitter is not supported (either through setLayout() or making the QSplitter a parent of the QLayout); use addWidget() instead.

So, it cannot be a table or other kind of `QLayout`.
